content:
We are a student-led robotics team established to compete in the Maritime RobotX Challenge.
For the 2025 season, we are participating in RoboBoat, and we plan to compete in the 2026 tournament as well. What is RoboBoat? RoboBoat is an international competition for small autonomous surface vehicles (ASVs) organized by RoboNation, held annually in March.
In this competition, participating teams design and construct their own hulls and integrate custom-developed control systems, sensors, and navigation algorithms to compete.
The vessels must operate fully autonomously and are required to complete various tasks during the competition.    OUXT Polaris has been participating in RoboBoat since last year. For more details, please refer to the article below:
https://note.com/lush_bonobo1853/n/nc0a60b1aad72
Additionally, we received a special award at RoboBoat 2025.
 OUXT Polaris plans to participate in RoboBoat again this year
     Small vessel built for the competition(2025)       Team members at work(2025)       Seeking sponsors The activities of OUXT Polaris are made possible through the support of our sponsors.
We are currently seeking sponsors to support our participation in RoboBoat and the Maritime RobotX Challenge.
For more details, please visit our Sponsorship page.
summary:
We are a student-led robotics team established to compete in the Maritime RobotX Challenge.
For the 2025 season, we are participating in RoboBoat, and we plan to compete in the 2026 tournament as well.

content:
At OUXT Polaris, we actively engage in speaking activities to share the knowledge gained through our development with the ROS community and the robot competition community. Below is a list of our past presentations.
 Competitions (Technical Documentation) In competitions like RoboBoat and the Maritime RobotX Challenge, “Technical Documentation” summarizing the technical details of vehicle development is included as a scoring item. We have published the materials written and presented by OUXT Polaris in the past.
RoboBoat    Competition Date Author Title     RoboBoat 2025 2025/03/06 Kenta Futami et al. Technical Design Report : OUXT Polaris 2025 (Florida)    RobotX    Competition Author Title      RobotX 2022 Kenta Okamoto et al. OUXT Polaris: Autonomous Navigation System for the 2022 Maritime RobotX Challenge (Australia)    RobotX 2018 Shuhei Horiguchi Development of a navigation system with high function and high reusability for Maritime RobotX Challenge 2018 (Hawaii)    RobotX 2016 Suisei Wada et al. Journal Paper about the development for the 2016 RobotX Competition (Hawaii)    RobotX 2014 Naoya Fujimoto et al. Catamaran Robot â€œPolaris -Iâ€ for Maritime RobotX Challenge 2014 (Singapore)      Academic Conferences ROSCon / ROSCon JP This is the world’s largest international and domestic conference for ROS (Robot Operating System) developers. OUXT Polaris has had multiple presentations accepted.

title: Seminars

content:
OUXT Polaris requires funding for robot development, manufacturing, and transportation.
Therefore, we are constantly seeking sponsors.
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.
We are currently looking for sponsors through the end of March 2026.
Financial Sponsors OUXT Polaris needs financial support to purchase robot components and cover transportation expenses.
We are looking for sponsors who can support us in this area.
In-Kind Sponsors At OUXT Polaris, we are developing fully autonomous ships using a variety of technologies and products.
We will feature your products in blog posts tagged with your company name.
If you lend us your products, we will count half the value of the products as sponsorship support.
If you are interested in supporting us, please feel free to contact us.
 Sponsorship Tiers     Gold Sponsor Silver Sponsor Bronze Sponsor     Sponsorship Amount Â¥1,000,000 or more Â¥500,000 or more Â¥300,000 or more   Logo Placement on Roboboat Large (max H 60 mm Ã— W 120 mm) Medium (max H 40 mm Ã— W 80 mm) Small (max H 30 mm Ã— W 60 mm)   Logo Placement Location Top and hull (one side only) Top and side (one side only) Top only   Company Logo on Team Uniform Large (max H 60 mm Ã— W 120 mm) Medium (max H 40 mm Ã— W 80 mm) Small (max H 30 mm Ã— W 60 mm)   Logo on Open-source Simulation 3D Model âœ… Yes (max H 200 mm Ã— W 400 mm) âŒ No âŒ No   Logo & Acknowledgement on Main GitHub Repository README âœ… Yes (1 line for logo + 1 line for name) âŒ No âŒ No   Company Logo on Official Website Sponsor Page 1 row per company 1 row for every 2 companies 1 row for every 3 companies   Acknowledgement on Web Magazine âœ… Yes (company name & logo) âœ… Yes (company name) âŒ No   Announcement on Teamâ€™s Social Media âœ… Yes âœ… Yes âœ… Yes   Invitation to and participation in OUXT results presentation âœ… Yes âœ… Yes âœ… Yes     Note:
When multiple logos are displayed together on the website, they will appear in the following order:
Gold Sponsors â†’ Silver Sponsors â†’ Bronze Sponsors.
For sponsors within the same category, the order will follow the agreement date.

title: Call for Sponsors

content:
OUXT Polaris needs a robot fabrication/development fee and a robot transportation fee.
For this reason, we are always looking for sponsors. For details, please refer to the Call for Sponsor.
If you have any questions, please contact us.
Gold Sponsors  CLOUDIAN    FURUNO    Northrop Grumman    Tier IV     Silver Sponsors  Mitsui E&S Shipbuilding    Yanmar     Bronze Sponsors  NVIDIA
